answers.answer: Hi...may I ask, have u talk to ur parents about these HA's?What other symptoms do u have, even if u do not feel they r related?Do u have activities that can trigger these HA's?IE- shouting.....jumping......lifting heavy items...straining.....etcHave u had a fall?....been in a MVA?If u have not talked to ur parents, I suggest u do asap, and it may require testing.Please keep us posted"selma"

I've been having a lot of aches and pains in my joints, hips, shoulders, etc. There are weird brown spots on the bottoms of my feet and I've been having random nausea while not on my menstrual cycle.Can't talk to parents about it, they aren't around. I live with my grandma and I can't worry her. That's why I'm trying this website.

I am sorry ur parents are not around for u, but do talk to ur Grandmother, I am sure she will be able to help u....PND= post nasal drip can cause nausea....could it be that?Sinus issues can cause HA's.....U deff need to be seen by a dr, so talk to ur GM.....if she begins to see u not feeling well she will worry regardless....share this with her ASAP.Post an update"selma"

I literally can't tell my grandmother. She has dementia, I think. She forgets or distorts anything she's told. And her husband's dying, so I'm not going to upset her just because I have some discomfort.

HiWelcome to the MedHelp forum!If you are in school then causes like eye strain, refractive errors like near and far sightedness, and cervical nerve root compressions due to faulty postures while using computers or reading could be the cause. It can also be a dental infection. Get this eliminated first. Ask an adult around to take you for an eye examination and to a dentist. Apart from that it can also be anemia, thyroid problem, diabetes, Low Vit B12 and host of other reasons that are causing whole body aches and pains. Take care!
Please advise ur guidance counselor  at school or the school nurse....do u have an Aunt or Uncle u can talk to?But do reach out to a trusted adult."selma"

question: I am fourteen years old and for as long as I can remember, I have had headaches. My headaches will last anywhere from ten minutes to a week. I'm still in school and as you can guess, these headaches make focusing hard. If anyone has any ideas, please help.
title: Random and lasting headaches
